document.docAuthor: Barahona-Segovia, Rodrigo M., Riera, Pamela, Pañinao-Monsálvez, Laura, Guzmán, Vicente Valdés & Henríquez-Piskulich, Patricia
document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 165–167. Allograpta exoticus (Wiedemann, 1830): (165) female in Rosa sp. (photo by Miguel Mellado). Allograpta hortensis (Philippi, 1865): (166) male on Leucheria sp. (photo by Daniel Llavaneras). Allograpta pulchra Shannon, 1927: (167) male on Orizoë sp. (photo by Daniel Llavaneras).

bibRefCitation.author: Philippi, P. I.
bibRefCitation.refString: Philippi, P. I. (1865) Aufzahlung der chilenischen Dipteren. Verhandlunger der Zoologisch- Botanischen Gesellschaft in Wien, 15, 595 - 782. https: // doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. title. 9295

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality and data.
“ Santiago , Valdivia , Chile ” (T, A, MNHNCL )
.
Chilean distribution. Known from Valparaíso to Magallanes region ( Fig. 170 ).
Altitudinal range. From coastal to highland ecosystems (5– 2,200 m .a.s.l.).

Biology and notes. Porter (1921) mentioned that professor Stuardo gave him specimens collected from flowers of
Aristolochia chilensis
. Smith-Ramírez et al. , (2005) recorded it in the native tree
T. stipularis ,
while Medan & Torreta (2015) associated it with
C. hystrix
. Other studies have revealed that the species is crucial for pollen transportation, especially for threatened species such as
Gomortega keule (Molina) Baill.
or trees whose fruits have local economic importance as
Gevuina avellana (
Lander et al. , 2009
)
. This flower fly species has also been observed visiting flowers of
E. pectinatus
(Gabriela Germain, CSP record);
Prunus
sp. (Chris Olea, CSP record);
Libertia chilensis (Molina) Gunckel
(Rodrigo Barahona-Segovia, pers. obs.);
Chrysanthemum
sp. (Karla Tutera, CSP record);
Leucheria
sp. (Daniel Llavaneras, CSP record);
P. chilensis
(Orlando Montes, CSP record);
Solenomelus pedunculatus (Gillies ex Hook.) Hochr
( César Martínez, CSP record) and
Crassula ovata
(Miller‎) ‎Druce (Jaime Ramírez, CSP record). Type probably lost.
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 9,354,163 km 2 , AOO = 196 km 2 , 34 subpoblaciones and 45 localities.
